title: Observation of a second critical field for negative ions in He II
abstract: We have measured the drift velocity v of negative ions in He I1 near 1 K, under a pressure of 25 bar, for electric fields E up to 17 kV/cm. Beyond Ec1, the critical field for creation of stable charged vortex rings, we have observed a second critical field Ec2 at which v passes through a minimum and then starts to increase again. Numerical values of the rate nu at which rings are nucleated, and of the rate P at which the ions escape from the rings again when E > Ec2, are calculated from the experimental data

        Observation of a second critical field for negative ions in He II</dc:title><dc:creator>
        Allum, D. R.</dc:creator><dc:creator>

        QC Physics</dc:subject><dc:description>
        We have measured the drift velocity v of negative ions in He I1 near 1 K, under a pressure of 25 bar, for electric fields E up to 17 kV/cm. Beyond Ec1, the critical field for creation of stable charged vortex rings, we have observed a second critical field Ec2 at which v passes through a minimum and then starts to increase again. Numerical values of the rate nu at which rings are nucleated, and of the rate P at which the ions escape from the rings again when E > Ec2, are calculated from the experimental data.</dc:description><dc:date>
